column1: Paraphimosis occurs when the foreskin of an uncircumcised male cannot be pulled back over the head of the penis.
Paraphimosis occurs most often in children and the elderly.
Symptoms include: - Inability to pull the retracted foreskin over the head of the penis - Painful swelling at the end of the penis - Pain in the penis
The health care provider will usually find a "doughnut" around the shaft near the head of the penis (glans).
Pressing on the head of the penis while pushing the foreskin forward may reduce the swelling.
